page.title: 10A WALK BESIDE THE NORTH TYNE
page.content: This walk meanders through the wooded valley and riverside meadows and begins near{Low Carry House}walking northwards and bearing right under a disused railway bridge on through a road gate past Thorneyhirst cottage, then turn left at the T junction, shortly leave road, follow a rough along the edge of field past ruined {High Carry House}and on to The Heugh,turn down towards the river, under railway arch to Countess Park farm.{The riverside path}goes by the ruined mill over the Prestwick burn on a footbridge. There is a clear footpath north through the woods along the river bank, a gate leads out from the meadow left and below the farm, the broad track follows the curve of the river under some fine old trees, past the{fishing lodge,}uphill to the disused railway line.
